column2: 2. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 4. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
5. A driver must use a turn signal at least ______ before making a turn or changing lanes.
6. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column8: must be ignored in snow conditions.
column10: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.

column2: 8. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
10. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column10: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column8: Traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 14. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column10: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 15. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lightsÂ to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 16. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
17. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.
column6: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.

column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column4: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column6: there is no need to signal.
column8: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column10: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
